thread.title: A Trial Drug May Have Helped My Late Daughter

author: wsjcom
title: A Trial Drug May Have Helped My Late Daughter
text: Regarding your editorial “Giving Patients One More Shot” (Feb. 5): I am reminded of my daughter’s situation in the late ’90s. She was diagnosed with chronic myelogenous leukemia and had a bone-marrow transplant, followed by “graft versus host disease.” At the time Gleevec was in the patient-testing phase. We asked a number of times if the FDA would allow her in the testing phase, but to no avail. This was difficult for me because my career had been in research microbiology and we were familiar with this whole procedure. She was denied permission and died just as Gleevec was being approved. It turned out to be hugely successful...
